intro: Operculicarya gummifera, commonly known as the gum tree, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, glandular leaves and showy blue or purple flowers. The plant produces a sticky, resinous substance known as gum, which gives it its common name. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often growing in rocky or coastal areas. Operculicarya gummifera is valued for its ornamental appeal and historical use in traditional medicine.
